fields.summary: Sprint burndown gadget asks for board twice instead of Sprint

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Sprint Burndown gadget is currently asking for the board twice:
 !gad.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a dashboard
# Add a Sprint Burndown gadget

h3. Expected Results

The second text should be "Sprint".

comments.body: It affects also JIRA 7.5.3
I'm from Pearson and would like to know when this simple issue (i.e. Text change only) get fixed?

fields.summary: Timeout errors can occur when completing sprints in Scrum boards

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If completing a sprint takes longer than 60 seconds one will experience a timeout message similar to the following:
 !release_timeout.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
* Bulk editing large amount of issues ( 200+ ) takes longer than 60 seconds

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a large number of issues in a sprint ( 200+ )
# Use remote fields, other customizations, or poor performance that results in bulk editing these issues to take longer than 60 seconds
# Attempt to complete sprint, receive error message


h3. Expected Results
A more descriptive error message is displayed like the one we implemented for Kanban boards, https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11775

h3. Actual Results
A generic timeout error is displayed
 
h3. Notes
Even though a timeout error is displayed the process does continue and issues within the sprint are completed successfully

comments.body: I experience similar issue on 7.12.3.
We have this issue in 7.13.8, even with a small amount bulk edits to a sprint
We have on 7.13.11

We have 8.5.1 and we get a timeout error when releasing issues from a Kanban board.

!image-2020-05-19-13-02-41-684.png!
I've 8.5.0, all time when I close sprint, go timeout. When I close, I put all issue to next sprint, if Jira go time, it put them in backlog
We are experiencing this when clicking "Release" in a Kanban board. We are getting a timeout and tickets are not removed from the "DONE" column. This occurs for us in Jira Datacenter 8.5.5
Got the same going on here - running 8.7.1.  I just hit "Complete Sprint" and chose to move 662 issues that are not yet complete to the new move.  That timed out.  This happens every month.

Hello, 

we are facing the same issues on Jira 8.13.1 and even with 50-100 issues!

Luckily sometimes the process is completed, but the Banner Error is quite annoying. :)

 

Any ETA on this?

Thank you!

We are hitting this occasionally as well in 8.13.2. 

Thank you,
Darin

We see this on Jira 8.20.6.  It really messed up the completed sprint value on the completed issues and seemed to pull in a load of issues not associated with the sprint into the Done column on the next sprint.
Jira 8.20.2 is also affected, but this could be a temporary workaround: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-change-the-default-ajax-timeout-in-jira-server-824345485.html]

Hi Team,

 

This really annoys our users, please try to give a fix ASAP.

 

Thanks

We need this to be solved urgently as we cannot minimize a number of incomplete issues in Sprint when it's closing. Timeouts caused more and more attempts by a user to complete the current sprint. Thus, there is kind of mess in DB and hours of work to actually make the Sprint look completed successfully.
v.8.20.14 also have the same error

fields.summary: Sprint goal field does not support/handle multi-line texts

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
When inputting a multi-line text in the Sprint Goal field, it either does not show the entire text or overlaps with the top of the backlog (see screenshots attached).

h3. Steps to reproduce.
Enter a text that spans multiple lines in the Sprint Goal field in an Agile Board.

h3. Expected results.
The field expands and the page adjusts to show the entire text without overlapping/covering other page elements.

h3. Actual results.
The field either shows a single line that does not fit the entire text or expands down covering the top of the backlog.

h3. Workarounds
None

comments.body: Updates?
I need this too.  I'm very surprised this was overlooked as part of the original implementation.
Do you have an ETA for the fix? Why offering this new UI if its not properly supported....
any update on this one?
any update on this please
Any updates for this?
*eagerly waiting!*

Are the screenshots from Jira data centre flavor? if yes, what version of Jira data centre are you guys running? We can only type in a single line? how did you get it to accept multi line input to expose this bug? We can't get this bug to surface in V 7.13.5 of Jira data centre.
Please vote on https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-20433
definitely find this limitation to be quite puzzling and unfortunate.
I would like to see this feature added as well.  Seems like a simple fix, and we often have more than one goal per sprint.
I like the attitude of commenters above. Not knowing Atlassian takes about 14 years to actually implement customer requests. See you in 10 years. 😄

우선 순위가 Row임에 따라 개선되지 않는 것 같습니다.

다중 라인이 꼭 되길 희망합니다.

Seriously! This bug is opened for two years and no one wants to take up the monumental effort of converting a single line text box to a multi-line box? Is the impact on the customer so non-obvious that it takes two years of time to Gather impact?
It's really frustrated when our team want to check the sprint goal with the current UI. We have couple goals to check, from UI they're messed up

+1 

well, this issue has only 2 years, they really tend to implement this kind of request in sprints of 5 years =D

Has anyone figured out what to do about this instead of waiting for Atlassian to fix this? I don't expect to be using Jira in 10 years time to see this being addressed. Obviously they have higher priorities with more value to address on their backlog!
Not sure the priority mechanism, but priority "low" given so many people complaining about this issue?
Any timeline for this one?

How hard would it be to add the basic styling afforded descriptions and comments to Goals. I can see why this particular change is a low priority compared to other issues. But given the number of users following this and what would seem to me like a low level of effort it is surprising this is not just getting knocked out. Just add CK editor to the goal input and you are done.

{color:#FF0000}*Very annoying!!*{color}
{color:#ff0000}*Very annoying!!*{color}

Agree with "Joel Eiholzer", it is open for nearly 4 years? I wonder Jira team is working in misplaced priorities. 

could you get this fixed ASAP.

Totally Agree. With the depreciation of the Sprint Boards on the Dashboard we now need to revert back to the Boards. Having squad goals in a better format would enrich this page.

Another option would be to add them to the insights feature which has just shown up
I do agree with what was said, this seems like a pretty low key issue, but a nice addition for the teams working with those boards. #upvote
Yes please.  Just enable the simple markup already available for issue descriptions.

How can it be possible to still be opened ?

It's only 1 line of CSS to change to make it works.

Sprint of 2 weeks = several objectives (I mean, sure !), I can't list my objectives as a list, but I can have a stupid smiley in my comments.

It's crazy. (x)(off)(*g)(flag)(?)(n)(n)(n)(n)(n)(n)(n)(n) ( <= this I can do !)
This is really annoying to see the goals in one line, it is very cheap to fix it!!
Please fix asap
Please fix! It's been 5 years...
wow, that's agile as hell
Any news?
Can it be fixed? It is not a big deal
Please fix as this is really annoying and causes consternation with the teams working on several features concurrently.
Hey team, is there any update? Could anybody please take care of this issue?

fields.summary: Ranking operations fail with the error message 'JIRA Software cannot execute the rank operation at this time. Other users may be ranking the issues that you are trying to rank. Please try again later.'

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

comments.body: Looks like this might be the same as JSWSERVER-15874 though this one seems to be MSSQL.

I can assure you this was never changed.

Looking at the definitions in fieldtype-mssql.xml under \WEB-INF\classes\entitydefs for 7.9.2, and just like 7.2.x, it still has:

<!-- Special types for the QUARTZ tables -->
<field-type-def type="quartz-char-8" sql-type="*VARCHAR(8)*" java-type="String"></field-type-def>
<field-type-def type="quartz-char-16" sql-type="*VARCHAR(16)*" java-type="String"></field-type-def>
<field-type-def type="quartz-char-40" sql-type="*VARCHAR(40)*" java-type="String"></field-type-def>
<field-type-def type="quartz-char-80" sql-type="*VARCHAR(80)*" java-type="String"></field-type-def>
<field-type-def type="quartz-char-95" sql-type="*VARCHAR(95)*" java-type="String"></field-type-def>
<field-type-def type="quartz-char-120" sql-type="*VARCHAR(120)*" java-type="String"></field-type-def>
<field-type-def type="quartz-char-200" sql-type="*VARCHAR(200)*" java-type="String"></field-type-def>
<field-type-def type="quartz-char-250" sql-type="*VARCHAR(250)*" java-type="String"></field-type-def>
<field-type-def type="quartz-char-512" sql-type="*VARCHAR(512)*" java-type="String"></field-type-def>
<field-type-def type="quartz-boolean" sql-type="*VARCHAR(1)*" java-type="Boolean"></field-type-def>

If you instruct SQL to create varchar columns, it will obey you, and that is totally what it is about that ;)

I can confirm that creating a new DB from an xml restore does NOT fix this problem, and never will unless we update the "Special types for the QUARTZ tables" section in your field type definitions.

Example: <field-type-def type="quartz-char-8" sql-type="*NVARCHAR(8)*" java-type="String"></field-type-def>

Of course, we customers could do this manually, but then we may find ourselves in an unsupported state.

Ideally, you would update this file yourself, and then we wouldn't be asked to tamper with a vendor database, a la JSWSERVER-12221

Thanks!
We are affected by this on MS SQL Server 2016, and we don't even have 1M issues.

We migrated the infrastructure and moved from MS SQL 2014 to MS SQL 2017, this problem got corrected after Jira Full reindex, some general Jira use and running the maintenance jobs. Still, our instance has the VARCHAR types assigned to RANK and LOCK_HASH, we have that work in the queue.
This happened again in MS SQL 2017, we re-run the maintenance jobs and it is still failing.

[~edgar.garcia]
Thanks for sharing your experience. Glad to hear that DB maintenance job fixes problem for you :)

fields.summary: Release Date picker broken when interface language is set to other language

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-68308].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When user interface language is set to German or other language than English, the Release Date picker shows 'undefined'.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new "Scrum software development" project
# Add a new release version in "Releases" page
# Change UI language to German or other language than English
# Try to release the newly created version and open the Release Date picker to modify the date

h3. Expected Results
Release Date picker get displayed correctly

h3. Actual Results
See screenshot below
 !2016-09-26_release-date.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* When using "Build and release", the Release Date picker get displayed correctly.
* Same issue can also be reproduced when UI language is changed to French, Russian, Korean and Japanese

h3.Workaround
Change the UI language to English.

comments.body: Closed as 'Cannot Reproduce'. Feel free to reopen if you will see this problems next time.
In French, we have the same mistake (version 7.2.7).

We have the same problem in v7.2.4 with German as User Language Setting.
Setting English as the suggested workaround does the job but is not very comfortable for the end users.
We have the same problem in v7.2.6 with German as User Language Setting.
We have the same problem in v7.3.5 with Russian as User lang set.
We have the same Problem in v7.3.0 with German user language.

One of our customers faces this problem in JIRA 7.4.1 as well. 
Also German language setting.
We have the same problem in v7.4.3 (german language setting).
One of our customers faces this problem as well after upgrading to v7.5.3 and german language.
Same problem with 7.8.1
Still exists in 7.12.3
A two years (!!) old issues was not solved for a feature, that will be used nearly daily by teams and for any iteration of the sprint?
Still present in 8.0.2
8.1.0 too. It is not that serious but just annoying. The other pickers are fine but only this date picker is not fine.
May be related with JRASERVER-62590 ?
Affects us on version 8.1.0 too if the language is set to "German" (de_DE)
Also present in 8.5.4 when language is set to german.

We are also affected by this issue. Running Jira on 2 different servers... one showing this behaviour, but the other does not.

I just compared system settings in Jira and this is what I found out:

While both servers are configured to display content in German language, the server running with a normal datepicker has (service-)user language set to "English (United States)", whereas the other is set to "Deutsch (Deutschland)". May be some endpoints of the server are generating date information according to these settings, though the frontend does expect a different format and this only happens if language wasn't set to "English (United States)".

What are the language settings of the user that runs the service? Perhaps setting this to 'Englisch (US)' solves this issue as a workaround...

If it does, please, comment on this for giving Atlassian some clues to look at it.
Also present in 8.13.1 when language is set to german.
Error present in french for version 8.13.1
Present in v8.13.3 in Finnish
Present in 8.16.1 for German.
Affects 8.20.3 too
